name: Last Hope - Tower Defense
description: Zombie Tower Defense: Join the ongoing war, in an open world, against the undead zombie horde. Choose between multiple powerful heroes all with unique epic gear and skills! With the wide variety of towers you can create your own perfect strategy.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: Intel Celeron Memory: 1024 MB RAM Graphics: Intel 4500 DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card: Built in
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel i5 Memory: 2048 MB RAM Graphics: Nvidia 930 DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card: Built in

reviews.review_text: I own almost every tower defense game on Steam, and all of the most popular.   This one is really very good, lots of towers and mobs, a lot of unlocks. Fair graphics, and it is fun. Highly recomend at this price.
Has the pick up and play style of a casual mobile game, except, there's depth and customization.

While it isn't the greatest tower defence game I've played I still found myself thoroughly enjoying what it had to offer from the range of heroes and accessories to buy down to the varuious types of towers you could utilise.  The story itself wasn't the greatest but that didn't bother to much as I more enjoyed doing the challenge levels on the harder difficulties.  Overall I'd say if you're a fan of tower defences give it a try

A lot of fun! This is a tower defense game, as the title suggests, but it adds much more depth and customization to the tower upgrades and especially the heroes. If you like tower defense and RPGs, this game is a great combination of both worlds!

*Edit* - Couple of updates later(and a new patch to my ati driver later), and the frequent crashes have become 'no crashes' - I am happy - the universe is at one again!  Fun little game! Unfortunately, it constantly crashes - had to restart a stage like five times - I want to play the game, therefore am keeping it, yet cannot recommend at present time...
Balls the wall TD, how it's meant to be.

This game is a mobile port which you can tell easily. You can see the pay wall and where things where sold for real $$ instead of ingame currency. Daily login bonus, ect... As a mobile game I would not recommend this game.  As for the PC version, I for sure recommend the game. You will get to points that you have to grind to level your characters and your towers, but I actually found it fun doing so. I have not fully beat the game yet, only two levels left, but the challenge is amazing and I am really enjoying the game.  Probably one of the best tower defense games with RPG elements on Steam.

Mobile port.   Better get some of the many free TD games in your Appstore, this is not worth 3â‚¬ for me.  Graphics are designed for mobile phones, sounds & music are not overwhelming aswell. I caught myself getting really impatient, hitting the fastfoward button as soon as possible. And i always expected some PayToWin buttons to pop up and beg for me to buy some gems or crystals...  I did not play enough to hit the sure to be expected mobile paywall, but it is not very inspired or difficult enough for staying longer. The first 6 levels can be played without even placing a tower, if you manage to get your hero to the right position.  If yo like TD games, give it a shot when it's on sale. But I am pretty sure every other TD veteran will look at this in disgust.
